item.title: Comment on Prices vs. price paths by Adam
item.description:
Reply to The Scary Black Hundreder:

"benefits from new pharma drugs are enormous."

Are they? I would have assumed that the benefits are in fact marginal and that most remaining low-lying fruit is in better diet and exercise for everyman.

How does one diet away glioblastoma?

item.title: Comment on Prices vs. price paths by Adam
item.description:
Reply to asdf:

Ozempic is like $1,000 on Medicare but you can buy if for like $200-$300 compounded. Watch the government just negotiate the compounded price and nothing changes except the gross to net distortion goes away.

$250 in Ecuador and not compounded.

item.dc:creator: Adam

item.title: Comment on Prices vs. price paths by Adam
item.description:
Reply to MDACC:

I’ve been dealing with a grade 4 glioma for 2.5 years now. There is no double blind study to support it, but logic and existing knowledge support a ketogenic diet for those with gliomas of all grades. Gliomas seem to need an outsize amount of glucose to thrive, and they do not process ketones well at all.

Also, bacon is delicious.

How are you thinking about Moderna's cancer vaccine?

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/prices-vs-price-paths.html?commentID=160792156

item.description:
Reply to Hazel Meade:

Right. Many Bernie Sanders supporters have claimed, with some justification, that the Democratic primary in 2016 was rigged in favor of Hillary Clinton.

Were those Bernie supporters right?
